summary: This document consists of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for July 28-29, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, and notably tracks inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who is listed as being on 'Psych Obs' (psychological observation) and later 'Suicide Watch' with an inmate companion. The logs show he was at a local hospital under USMS guard and later at Goldcrest nursing facility and Brooklyn Hospital.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate (Register Number 76318-054) documented as being on psychological observation and suicide watch, with an inmate companion, and noted as being at local hospitals under USMS guard.

persons.name: Gil-Cabral
persons.context: Inmate (Register Number 86292-054) documented as being taken to and returning from the local hospital (L-HOSP) on July 28, 2019.

connections.description: Both were inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center during the same time period, as recorded in the daily logs.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on psychological observation and suicide watch in late July 2019 while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epinson was accompanied by an inmate companion while on psychological observation and suicide watch.
Epstein was transported to and held at external medical facilities (Goldcrest nursing facility and Brooklyn Hospital) under guard by the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS).
The correctional facility logs show routine counts and operational details, including non-operational fire alarm systems and PREA announcements.
The logs cover the dates July 28 and 29, 2019, which are approximately two weeks before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
